caption:
This photograph features an abstract artistic representation with distinctive textures and vivid colors. The central object of the image is a round shell with a spiraled pattern, which exhibits a gradient from white at the edges to a dark center, suggesting depth and inner complexity. The shell is placed against a background that has swirling, marbled patterns resembling liquid or molten material, primarily in dark purples and black hues, which stretch across the entire frame.

The patterns surrounding the shell create a dynamic contrast of organic lines and movements, seemingly flowing around the shell, which serves as a stable, calming element in the midst of more chaotic surroundings. The thin, white swirls in these patterns enhance the fluidity and add a sense of motion to the composition. The overall effect is both mysterious and hypnotic, with the shell anchoring the viewer's focus while the surroundings invite exploration and interpretation.
title: Close- up of a forest snail on a alder leaf in timberland on vancouver island, british Columbia.  Near port alberni, british Columbia, canada.  From the environmental protection agencys project documerica collection, " in praise of forests".  For additional images see fiche #s 209, 210, 211, 212, and 213.  Entheos.  October, 1974.
